It does not have an incredibly long range, but it should, at the very least, be "somewhat helpful."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's pretty cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're giving this to us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm lending it to you. Should you wish this to be part of the trade instead of something from "my collection..."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No no no. Lending is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lending is perfectly agreeable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now I have lent you something in the past, and not only did it not return to me, but I had to "extract the funds by forcing another contract on you. Can I trust you to complete this endeavor?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can trust us, as far as Grog can throw me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pretty fucking far.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can trust her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Deal." And he hands it out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We will make our way into the city, and when we do, we will look for your items.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. I appreciate that."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or we could just send Vex on a broom right now to get it solo--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what? What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are not flying a half-elf into the city on a broom that she has already fallen off of in the last 24 hours.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Archers!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am recovering a bit right now, but thank you for the wonderful, wonderful idea, Scanlan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think you can do it. I think you can do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you! I appreciate the vote of confidence.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He is a tactician.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, what might this item be called, Sir Quall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't named it, actually. I made it for myself. Call it what you like."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about "The Hunk of Quall"?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Hunk of Quall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Should you wish, certainly."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Didn't we had a conversation about letting him name things? I feel like we had this conversation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Always do it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Enjoy carrying among yourselves The Hunk of Quall."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. Drez Vina, it hasn't been a pleasure, nice to see you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drez crosses his arms, "Indeed. All right, good luck."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And can I take Pike around the shoulder and lead her out of the tent?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, hey... hey, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I'm glad things have been good at Whitestone. They've been good, yeah?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, they've been all right, I mean, it's okay, I've been missing you guys, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we miss you a whole lot. Listen, I've got some rough news, actually. We made it back to Westruun, and the city has kind of been ransacked and overtaken. It was attacked by a bunch of dragons, and what's worse is that after it was attacked-- you know that herd of wandering goliaths that left me for dead in the woods?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they've kind of taken control of the city, and I think that's my family that's in there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Look, we wanted to go in, I wanted to look for Wilhand, but we haven't done it yet, and--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Have you heard anything else? Do you think they are okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not really sure where he is.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Well, I wonder if we should go look for him

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're going to be there, in the city, and I was wondering what you might think about going to look for a few other more Vestiges, trying to find Osysa's mate and seeing if we can find anything that can help us, because it's going to be a fight, right? And you know me: I fucking love a fight, but--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a lot of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's a lot.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think we should wait until we're fully prepared.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you think so?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think so. I don't think it's safe any other way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I missed you so much!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh Grog, I missed you too!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I cry a little bit into my beard, and I wipe it away I'm like: Oh! The pollen out in these fields is awful! (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's okay, Grog! I give him a hug, and I take my blue scarf and I pat his eyes.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As soon as we find this out, if we find nothing-- I promise, I pledge to you that we will find Wilhand.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, is the task then to go find the orcs that are keeping their people hostage up in the Frostweald?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We head into the Frostweald, we find the orcs and send them back and keep going and find this Sphinx-y mate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we have any other information of where he is in the Frostweald or do we just know Frostweald?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just know Frostweald. Pike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The information that you received was, somewhere in the base of the Stormcrest Mountains, past the Frostweald.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Past the Frostweald?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Through it to the base of the mountain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of the what mountain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stormcrest Mountains.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a real place.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Actually, Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been holding on to something, and I think you might like it. I have these Gauntlets of Ogre Power, and I can't wear them anymore, because I got some new stuff, and if you wear it, your strength score goes up to 19.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want them? You have to attune to them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you think they'll fit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think they might shrink. I don't know, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you know what 19 means?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Isn't it like a French dish?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I would love to wear those.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, and I give Pike the Gauntlets of Ogre Power.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys take a short rest to prepare for this, Ashley, you take some time with the gauntlets, and while you're looking them over and taking your own armored gauntlets off and replacing them with these, your hand goes-- It's like placing a baseball into a bucket. It's so big around your arm. But then as you take a moment to see the metal and reflect upon it, you can feel the hum of magical energy that begins to invisibly intertwine with your forearm as the metal begins to creak almost, and it shrinks down, encases itself to your forearm. While it doesn't match the metal of your armor, the silver-gold theme that goes on along it with this weird ogreish face that's built into the plate there, you feel suddenly this surge of strength begin to spill through your body, and you're pretty confident that this may be useful in the near future.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're stronger than Grog now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are technically now stronger than Grog.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I let out a little battle cry. (battle cry)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, and I go to give her a fist bump.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I fist bump him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it hurts you a little bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit! Pike is so strong!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit. Nice, Pike!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, what was your strength before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. At a 19, you're now at a plus four as opposed to a plus one to all your hit and damage with your physical weapons.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You just Tyler Durden-ed out, son!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So on your sheet, where it has your attack bonus with your mace, or with your morningstar, and the damage, add a plus three to both the attack bonus and damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, because right now my attack bonus is plus seven, so I add three to that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's now plus ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Holy moley!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's so cool! You're a beast!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Little golden bullet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, I am unprepared for all this strength!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we make our way towards that area they said that the orc raiders were coming from?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's a couple days from here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On foot travel, it's about a day and a half.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For mist form?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mist form, you'll get there by nightfall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we can't use it, because she already used the travel through the trees.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we saved all those people, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, can you make us mist?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, I can't do anything like that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's walk.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like I haven't spent any time with Vax.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With Vax? Oh, he's around. You know, he's probably just sulking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance back and see Vax towards the back of the group. Noticing this conversation, Vax immediately turns around and walks away and dodges around one of the nearby tents.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Big nope to that one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is the weather like outside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, today it's spotty clouds, but blue sky. It's actually pretty good weather, versus a lot of the rain that you had over in Vasselheim.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cold, snowy on the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Because you're getting a little further south than the northern area of it, the temperature is probably around high 70s, low 80s.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is going to get cold, though, once we head into the Frostweald. We had all those fancy cloaks. I had winter's cloaks for all of us before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I still have mine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does everyone still have their winter's cloaks from a long time ago?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, wow, yes, look at that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't burn it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're just going to walk? Do these refugees have any horses or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're refugees.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The few horses they do have are currently quartered to wagons and look to be more beasts of burden for, if they have to move, to carry most of their goods with them, as opposed to riding horses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, man, let's just hoof it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, we'll walk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, are we walking? We haven't walked anywhere in so long.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like we're back in New York again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like we're level three again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And those horses will survive, because you didn't take them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's fucked up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really sad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Take a walk. Save a horse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a good Vox Machina bumper sticker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My other horse is walking.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Coming to the Geek and Sundry store.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys make your Fellowship trek southward with the sweeping camera drone shot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I constantly keep an eye out for anything in the front of us and behind us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thankfully, most of these fields, of varying degrees of grass height, but for the most part it's pretty wide vision of where you're heading.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I paint pictures in the clouds as we go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good. That'll definitely not let anyone know magical people are on their way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just point arrows in the opposite direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Graffiti as we go.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I insight-check Vax?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Roll an insight check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This never happens.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You just saw all of his dirty dreams.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What does she see and read on your face and body language, Vax?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got to say this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can say it, if you want to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't want these assholes to know what I'm thinking. I don't know. Can't whisper it to her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can text it to her real fast, if you want.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll text it to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But put it on Twitter so that everybody else knows what it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll post it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you'll have an incoming text of information. As you guys continue walking, these are the observations you make of Vax as you travel southward. You travel for the better part of a day. You get quite a bit south. You do see in the distance a few times what appear to be some pack animals, some larger beasts that roam the land, none that are necessarily aggressive unless you encroach upon their territory, and Keyleth, you have experience with some of these beasts, so you manage to keep people at bay and traverse around what they claim as their own landscape. No terrible detriment to your traveling speed. You make your way to the point where the sun goes down. You can stop and camp for the night or you can push through the evening. What do you wish to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any trees nearby?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Little periods here, little tiny groves that might be spotty along your journey, but for the most part it's open fields.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much further do we have, do you think?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One more day. One more eight-hour period of travel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably rest, then, right? We'll be hitting the Frostweald at night tomorrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not in a rush.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not anymore. The dragons are bunkered down, I believe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything we do now is measured in weeks and months and not days.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I still have a little dried blood on the outside of my ear. I could use a bit of rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, yeah, do you have a concussion? Is that something that we can-- how many fingers am I holding up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're really blurry, Percy, I have no idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Save versus brain swelling. Are you guys setting up camp?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to pull my brother aside when we set up camp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we want camp, or do you want to sleep in a mansion?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike hasn't seen your beautiful mansion!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you have to show her the marble floors.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we want to do it now, or do we want to do it tomorrow night, is the question?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can do it both.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right-- We can do it both nights?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can do it every day, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Where do you have a mansion?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan has a mansion, Pike!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There was a great-uncle Vesuvius.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also known as Uncle Touchy. Uncle No-No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Canon, that's canon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll sleep in the mansion tonight, and they all know where they're sleeping, but I'll personally show Pike to her chambers, which are right next door to mine at the end of the long hallway. My room, obviously, the biggest, tallest. Pike's a close second. Beautiful, covered in yellow rose petals as far as you can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Pike, as Scanlan creates this somewhat shimmering door of mystical energy in the middle of the air off of the path you guys have been walking, in the middle of this field. It's just the open grass that's blowing with this gentle night breeze, a little bit of the moonlight is coming through the clouds, giving enough of a visual of this change in the air space. He pushes open the shimmering door, and on the inside is this beautiful mansion. Tall foyer with marble floors, pillars that raise to the ceiling with gold trim. There's a giant portrait in the center of the main stairway now that has both Scanlan and you on horseback over a beautiful landscape. There are a number of mystical servants that are somewhat transparent and spiritual, arcane energy in form, that take your coats and offer food. A delicious meal is presented for all of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mostly chicken.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mostly chicken. It's a lot of chicken.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm having a lot of talk with the servants about different ways to prepare food.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Please do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They keep clucking it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Protein, bro! Scanlan does lead you to your room, which is right next to his, and covered in yellow rose petals, a beautiful interior. The color scheme is marked tailored specifically to your tastes that he's been able to glean from conversations with you over the past couple years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Blues, silvers. There's a little mini prayer area for her to pray to Sarenrae, and there's a little statue of Sarenrae, and if you pull it, a little secret door opens to my room. But it's a small door that only a gnome could fit through.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, great! Is there a lock on that, maybe? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Only on my side.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Oh, this is beautiful, Scanlan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just keep an eye on it. I don't know what it is, and maybe you could just check it out next time you're friending it up with him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. When they had that fight with Percy, up in the house, I felt like there was something weird with that sword. I'll check it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's all I care about.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thanks, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the servants, I assure you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I find-- Is there a library in the mansion, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I pull my brother into a library or something? I just want to talk to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What? What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, weirdo. I couldn't help but notice, anywhere Pike was, you were not, all day today, and I have a feeling it's because--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to talk?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a feeling it's because of this Raven Queen situation. I don't know. I know that you offered yourself to her to save me, and I can't put into words how much that means to me. I'm worried that she took you up on the offer, and I know you're worried about it, too. And I'm afraid that's why you're avoiding Pike. You're afraid she's going to see something in you. But I wanted to tell you, I've been looking through this book. It's the best 35 gold I've ever spent. Maybe it was 30 gold, I don't even remember anymore.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was 30.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I tell you what I found?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bring down those who try to cast off the chains of fate. The Raven Queen represents death, right? Therefore she hates those that live an immortal life. She hates vampires! We hate vampires! They're terrible people, right? That's not bad! Watch for the cult of Orcus, and stamp them out whenever they arise. Orcus is bad. If she hates him, then she must not be that terrible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's already speaking to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. And?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, Vex'ahlia. I don't know what this means. I know that she's not a force for evil. Neither are funeral homes. I don't want to bed down in one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's understandable.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But it doesn't matter. And I'd do it again, because I did it for you, and I am trying to come to terms with it, not knowing the terms.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. We've lived half our life in the shadows. You've made them your home. Am I right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a time you can either let those shadows swallow you down and keep falling into a hole, or you can use them to your advantage. You can become a champion. It's pretty fucking badass, if you ask me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know how bad this armor smells?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can smell it, actually. Pretty terrible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's several centuries old. It's not pleasant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we can get you some oils or something to put on it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What I'm saying is, brother, I'm proud of you, and I'm happy for you, and I'm so, so thankful for you. And you don't need to be frightened! This is a wonderful thing. Not many fucking people can say they're a champion of a fucking god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Listen. I'll take what you say under consideration. Again, none of us, you and I don't know what this means. I'm waiting to see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. But as someone who's seen the other side and has come back thanks to you, there's no use living your life in fear. I love my reckless brother, as much as he hurts my heart. I love you for that, and don't be afraid to be that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have no clever answer to give you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's wonderful. I love you. And I walk away! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go to bed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Before Scanlan disappears, I grab him as he's leaving.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just making the rounds, make sure everyone's tucked in for the night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wasn't looking in on Pike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have you, perhaps, installed some sort of workspace in this wonderful home of yours for me? I've got a few little projects I want to poke at.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean the all-purpose room?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Room of Requirement?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a little worried by what all-purpose necessarily means.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't look in there with a black light.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not really a work table, is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is the danger room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's all purposes, Percy. All purposes. But yes, it is a private room. No one can hear you scream in there. It's the farthest wing we have. I can give you some servants to help you set something up, bring in some tables, whatever. We don't have much in here, we're not prepared for chemical reactions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing complicated, just some very basic blacksmithing and a little bit of leatherwork.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I have that stuff? Anything to help him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. If it was prepared within the house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I tried to make enough stuff for all of us to have our basic needs met.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can think of some very sexy things that can be done with an anvil. Think about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All my anvils are gnome-sized.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's comical.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth pops her head out into the hallway. Did I hear something about working? Are you working?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. Scanlan's helping me find a room that apparently is so sound-proof we don't actually have to hear anyone else's drama.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's fantastic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. Grab a book. It'll be fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might join you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you going to have a working dinner? I'll send some chickens down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't sleep, so, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about cows?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No cows in my room either, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I join Percy and help him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The smithing gear that is brought to you by the servants in itself is very, very finely crafted and nearly weightless. It's really impressive, and you look at the label, and it has a small timer on it before it becomes immaterial.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can work with materials that are in the Bag of Holding, that are real materials, as long as I put them back in the Bag of Holding and take them with me? I can't leave anything, obviously.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Anything you leave in here will just be spat out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, it'll just be spat out. That's lovely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, onto the ground where it was.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For the moment, because I don't have everything I need for the broom yet, I want to work on a piece of jewelry, if that's okay. I want to work on the thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Work on jewelry?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to construct a little piece of jewelry if that's okay. Not magical.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have a jeweler's kit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I have a jeweler's kit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a whole different skill set, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't tinker something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can tinker something, but jewelry is different from tinkering.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, well, this is a piece that has purpose. It actually is going to be a functional object.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is the function of this object? You need to tell me these things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. This is something that I-- I'm so sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to make something! Make me roll for it! I got to know what you're doing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to make a-- I'm so sorry, I'm losing the word.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Percy, what are you trying to make?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Something that's too complicated to explain to you. I'm blanking on it. I may have to just give you the name at the break. A little herb pouch, like one of those cages that close up to put herbs in them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, like you make tea with?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It won't be pretty, but you can make it functional. Yeah, go ahead and make a tinkering check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'll make it pretty later.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like a Shoprite bag with a bunch of shit in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This will be a dexterity mod, because it's not a very complicated piece based on what you've constructed in the past. It's more about your ability to make it work.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dexterity? Thank god, because that's a terrible roll. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. Okay, it takes you the better part of the night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I assist him at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a job this small, there's not a whole lot you can assist with except handing him tools.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not going to run the whole night. At some point I'm going to be like, I don't have the design yet. This is something I want to get right, so this is going to be working towards it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you get the first stage of that set and ready to go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so embarrassed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all eventually find yourselves to rest, tasks completed to the extent of which you wanted to, conversations finished. You find yourselves at breakfast, a delightful spread of breakfast chickens prepared for you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I pick one up off the table and I say, hey Vex! (whoosh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit! I'm not even on my-- (grunt)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of you duck instinctively as the chicken has enough time to arc and begin to plummet down before she gets her arrow out, and you see her aiming downward as it falls. As she releases the arrow, it manages to catch it. Go ahead and roll for an attack, see how well it hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good. 30?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (arrow impact)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wait, 28, 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of the servants scoops it up and sets it back on the table in front of Keyleth with the broken arrow shaft sticking out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like that game. It's my new favorite game.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want some more broom target practice?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I need to practice with this broom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You do need to practice, seriously.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have more chickens.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got stuff to do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we have stuff to do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm still eating. I would love to see you, for five minutes, get up on that broom and fly around and fucking put some arrows in some chickens.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it help me at all to practice on this broom?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It helps me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will command seven servants to each have a loaded chicken at the ready.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pull!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I start flying.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vax, you can do the honors and say the pulls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I clench really hard with my thighs to try to hold on to this broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rest of you enjoy what is the strangest of Medieval Times experiences you've had, glancing upward to the raised ceiling of this dining room area, you watch Vex spiral around on her broom before, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vax is saying pull.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pull!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (chicken clucking)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll, with disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Jesus. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Say it. Say it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Easiest number to count to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as the first chicken goes in the air, she reaches and goes to aim. However, she catches herself. The broom throws her off, and she stops just in time and haphazardly focuses on just the chicken, not realizing where the chicken had now fallen past. Releases it. Scanlan, I want you to make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, that's not that bad. Damage? Oh, it's automatic hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Oh, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Full damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Scanlan, as you're watching this, chewing, suddenly, (impact).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (screaming)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit! Scanlan, Scanlan, I'm so sorry! I land, I land. I land and I instantly cast Cure Wounds on him. Fuck, I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A big old chicken dangling at the end of the arrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike! Pike, help, help, help, help!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm just applauding. Again! Again! I pick up my chicken and I throw it at Scanlan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does this mean when the night's over there's going to be a little pool of blood where the door was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'll find out. Go ahead and roll for healing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, God, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Vex reaches out and grasps you and manages to heal some of your wounds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good, that's good. It's just 1d8, do I add anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 1d8 plus your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you heal 11 hit points.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I pull out the arrow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. A gout of blood sprays out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hold my hand there. Pike, can you help?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll help, I'll help. That broom is amazing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Isn't it, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes! And there are too many chickens in here, anyway. Healing Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, you're just casting a Cure Wounds?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, I'll cast Cure Wounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wound closes as Pike reaches out and, with a small chuckle, heals how many hit points?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The chicken comes back to life!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What did you say, Matt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How much do you heal? Roll 1d8 plus five, I'm pretty sure. That was amazing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, Scanlan. You can blame my brother.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike's there holding her hands on your shoulders, closing the wound.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Well, let's say breakfast is over.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to practice a bit more, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other servants are holding their chickens at the ready.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pull.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go, go, go!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I try punching one in the air with my new gauntlets?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As he's about to throw it up, Pike runs over and grabs the chicken and throws it and (boom) punches it in the air. Pike, roll a strength check. Roll a d20 and add plus four to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 20 chicken McNuggets fly through the air.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is so dumb, why am I doing this? What am I doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d20, add four to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For the greater good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, it's not that high. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11, okay. You (boom) bat it up with a Pike punch. We'll say for the sake of brevity on this, go ahead and roll one more attack, and this will count for the rest of the shots. With disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, come on. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, okay. You do manage to recover your sense of self-esteem as you manage to pin a couple more chickens against the walls and the table in here, but each arrow is just a reminder of the one stray that began this whole breakfast excursion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry about that, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great job, Vex.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, this is the best brunch we've ever done.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will never forget it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was great. Thank you for that, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably get a start on a walk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, so, question, before we leave, you guys--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to make the archery booth at Renn Faire hilarious. Sorry, okay. Carry on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we want to travel via Wind Walk, or are we okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're only eight hours away?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's only eight hours. Save your strength.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I can save my strength.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, save it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. All right. Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We might come across some orcs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hopefully. Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, right? I could use some.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's set out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys say good-bye to your servants, gather yourselves as you step out and the door closes behind you. Do you choose to leave the spell up, or are you going to fade it as you walk along?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I leave it up, can anyone go in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone that you allow into it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to see if the blood comes out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'll shut the door and hide the key under a rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys continue walking southward towards the Frostweald. About another seven to eight hours of travel along that way, you begin to see the Stormcrest Mountains in the distance get closer and loom larger and larger, and you get the feel of the Stormcrest Mountains especially because there is a very large storm surge that seems to rise from the ocean to the east of it that has caused a very heavy thunderstorm that's blasting through. You can't see the peaks of the mountains from this distance. There are clusters of trees and forest areas along, but ahead of you, you can see, coated in a very, very bright, visibly white forest, this is the Frostweald itself, with snowfall. Once again, you've been here before, and there is an essence, and you don't recall the specific reason for it, but there is a purpose, an ancient purpose, as to why this one area is perpetually sitting in the heart of winter. Amongst what is a relatively temperate, in some places almost tropical temperature layer, it is very strange, and part of the mystical calling to the Frostweald is that it is perpetually locked in a winter state. You-- don't worry, I'm working on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth takes a second to meditate on the previous time that we were here in the Frostweald, and I cast Find the Path. 6th-level spell. Which gives me the most direct, shortest route as long as I'm on the same plane existence of where I'm going, if I have a vague idea of where I'm going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are you going?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to the Stormcrest Mountains, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're trying to get to the Stormcrest Mountains through, but we're also looking for the band of orcs travelling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you name a destination on another plane of existence, a destination that moves, or a destination that isn't specific, such as a green dragon's lair, the spell fails.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we're in the Frostweald, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You're approaching it now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is the Frostweald considered on a different plane?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. But do you have a specific location that you're familiar with that you want to go to?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I can find us the shortest, most direct route to the Stormcrest Mountains.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have we been there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can see them. I'm trying to figure out. For the spell to work, you have to choose a specific location that you're already familiar with to lead you to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you saying?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Stormcrest Mountains. But just because I can see them doesn't necessarily mean we're going to find the most direct path, shortest direct path towards it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right? Or is this a waste of a spell and I should just do something else?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will give you the benefit to say that you can see the mountain range. This is more useful if it's trying to find a place that you're very familiar with, seen a picture of, or you had a very specific bit of information for it. For a general location or a location that you're unaware of, the spell wouldn't have an effect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you could think of the location of her mate, the sphinx's mate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know it, so it fails. That's why I was trying to do Stormcrest Mountains, but apparently that's not specific enough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, is it specific? It's just we can see them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a large range that's very visible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's move on, let's move on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll do something else.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Save it for something special.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys press forward to the outside of the Frostweald, the snow- and ice-covered treeline is a very familiar sight from your last time traveling here. There are canopies of pine-like trees that interlock with windless snowfall, that leave a fairly dark interior set from the frozen-over canopy. Slick surfaces and knee-deep snowbanks permeate this entire forest region. Your breath is immediately visible as you step past that threshold, and the temperature drops about 40 degrees from what it was before, getting steadily colder the further in you travel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bet you're glad you have that beard now, huh? Keeps you warm? No?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's actually quite nice out here. This is like spring for me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are your people-- Did you grow up in the cold?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're pretty cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pressing in, as the temperature drops further and further, you occasionally come across a broken sunbeam that manages to penetrate aspects, different places in the canopy, and even stepping into those, they don't lend any change in temperature or warmth. The enchantment that surrounds this entire forest doesn't seem to be moved by such natural incursions. Everyone go ahead and roll a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 25. Are we in the woods? 29.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are walking through, keeping your eyes peeled, Vax, you're so lost in thought that your eyes glaze over for a second and you forget where you are. Pike and Vex, the two of you get a little bit ahead of the rest of the group, pushing through the snow. You come around from a tree and you can see, this is about an hour or so into your entrance to the Frostweald, you see a small clearing with a few patchy trees outside of the heavy canopy, and what appears to be a couple of small stone ruins and a single obelisk, a monolith-like pillar of stone that juts out of the snow. It's about 200 feet away from you guys, 250 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see anything around it? Any people, any trace of tracks in the snow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this distance, no. You don't see any, there are no figures, there is no movement. There is just that stone piece that, at a slight angle, stands out amongst the rest of the treeline.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you see?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a tall stone thing, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah? So?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go over.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vex, you and I should hang back, but we'll let everyone else.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a big obelisk? Are there any birds or anything like that around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every footfall that hits the snow, you can hear the crunch resounding and echoing through the nearby vicinity. It is just a still, silent atmosphere in this forest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (clanging) Pike!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let me check if it's safe to move on. And I reach down and scoop up a handful of snow, right? Just snow? How's it taste?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the clearest snow you've tasted in a long time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit's crazy pure, yo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So then we're safe to move ahead?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're good. Let's go check out the scary obelisk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody starts inhaling snow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you moving ahead, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm moving ahead. Who wants to come with me to the obelisk?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to hide behind a tree and watch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the what? What obelisk?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For what? Why are you hiding?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just going to keep guard!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll come with you, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's nobody out here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've had bad luck touching things lately. I'm letting other people touch things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, Keyleth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike's coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Grog, Keyleth, Pike, and Scanlan are all going forward. Looks like Vex, Vax, and Percy are staying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm getting another angle so that we have two different vantage points of what may happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Getting a little closer, but keeping.

Weathered somewhat, but not too heavily, so it's either not very old or there's not a whole lot of weather that comes through here, and by the stillness of the wind since you've entered, you get the feeling that's probably more the case. It's hard to gauge how old or how long it's been here. But there are various carvings amongst it. There is a big symbol. I want to have you guys roll a religion check real fast.

You're finding pieces of broken stone, smaller chunks about that big and bits of stone dust that are scattered amongst the snow. You push around, because you see the ruined walls around. You do find a larger piece of stone that looks like a broken statue, like there must have been some sort of a statue here that had lost the hand, and it's stumbled there on the ground.

lines.text: Arms, part of a torso, like somebody had knocked over a series of statues. A lot of them have deep grooves in them, like these statues were either carved to pieces, like they were physically torn down--

lines.text: Hello, and welcome back, everyone. So. As the snow is melted away, revealing this garden of statues in various states of-- some of them are still solid, some of them are just missing pieces, some of them are entirely shattered, many of them crushed or torn, thick, heavy grooves visible on the pieces of them that have been torn asunder-- the party begins to gather their thoughts and figure out what this might be. You did notice as well that there was writing or script among the bottom of the obelisk, and as the snow melts away, there is another large shape that is carved into it.

What you can see, this clearing itself is visible from your height, but once you get above the tree-line, you can see the trees are pretty thick. You don't see any signs of basilisks in the vicinity. You, upon looking around the ground, you can see-- it's very muddy now from all the snow that had melted down, and you see that some of the mud is slicking into holes in the ground. Already the slushy atmosphere is-- snow and fire scatter around it as they both screech out in pain. DC of what?
